These are notes about the component.

Grid

A grid system helps keep elements aligned and in proportion. Our grid system is based on 12 columns.

Visual

Code

.col-md-1
.col-md-1
.col-md-1
.col-md-1
.col-md-1
.col-md-1
.col-md-1
.col-md-1
.col-md-1
.col-md-1
.col-md-1
.col-md-1
.col-md-8
.col-md-4
.col-md-4
.col-md-4
.col-md-4
.col-md-6
.col-md-6
<p>A grid system helps keep elements aligned and in proportion. Our grid system is based on 12 columns.</p>
<h4>Visual</h4>
<div style="overflow-y:auto;height:300px;text-align:center;">
  <img src="/design/images/grid-example.png" alt="" style="margin:0 auto;">
</div>
<h4>Code</h4>
<style>
  .demo-grid .row {
    background: #eee;
    border: solid 1px #ccc;
    margin-bottom: 15px;
    line-height: 50px;
  }
  .demo-grid .row div {
    border-right: solid 1px #ccc;
  }
  .demo-grid .row div:last-child {
    border-right: none;
  }
</style>

These are notes about the component.

Typography

Semantic Hierarchy

Establish a visual and semantic hierarchy by nesting headings correctly. For example, an H3 follows an H2 when it denotes a section contained within the H2's content. Don't skip to an H4 after an H2, etc. Don't use headings arbitrarily based on their presentation.

Element Size Description

Page Title

36px

The main page heading is an H1 element. You should use it once on the page, at the top of the Dashboard

Heading

30px

 The page heading is an H2, which may be used as a page-level element. More than one may be used on the page.

Third-level Heading

24px Bold

The heading to the left is an H3 element, which may be used after an H2 heading in the document hierarchy.

Fourth-level Heading

18px Bold

The heading to the left is an H4 element, which may be used after an H3 heading in the document hierarchy.
Fifth-level Heading
14px Bold

The heading to the left is an H5 element, which may be used after an H4 heading in the document hierarchy.
Sixth-level Heading
12px Uppercase

The heading to the left is an H6 element, which may be used after an H5 heading in the document hierarchy.

Text Formatting

Element Size Description
Bold (strong) text Inherited Use <strong> for Bold text.
Italic (emphasized) text Inherited Use <em> for italicized text.
Small text 85% of default size Use <small> for smaller text.
Hyperlink Inherited

Unless specified by another component, hyperlinks use the standard hyperlink color #3179C2 and are not underlined except on hover.
Ordered List
  1. Item
  2. Item
  3. Item

Use ordered lists to semantically group items in a pre-determined order
Unordered List
  • Item
  • Item
  • Item

Use unordered lists to semantically group related items

 
<h3>Semantic Hierarchy</h3>
<p>Establish a visual and semantic hierarchy by nesting headings correctly. For example, an H3 follows an H2 when it denotes a section contained within the H2's content. Don't skip to an H4 after an H2, etc. Don't use headings arbitrarily based on their presentation.</p>
<table class="table">
  <tr>
    <th style="width:33.333%">Element</th>
    <th style="width:33.333%">Size</th>
    <th>Description</th>
  </tr>
  <tr>
    <td><h1 class="page-title" style="font-weight:200;">Page Title</h1></td>
    <td><h1 style="font-weight:200;">36px</h1></td>
    <td><p>The main page heading is an H1 element. You should use it once on the page, at the top of the Dashboard</p></td>
  </tr>
  <tr>
    <td><h2 style="font-weight:normal;">Heading</h2></td>
    <td><h2 style="font-weight:normal;">30px</h2></td>
    <td>The page heading is an H2, which may be used as a page-level element. More than one may be used on the page.</td>
  </tr>
  <tr>
    <td><h3>Third-level Heading</h3></td>
    <td><h3>24px Bold</h3></td>
    <td><p>The heading to the left is an H3 element, which may be used after an H2 heading in the document hierarchy.</p></td>
  </tr>
  <tr>
    <td><h4>Fourth-level Heading</h4></td>
    <td><h4>18px Bold</h4></td>
    <td><p>The heading to the left is an H4 element, which may be used after an H3 heading in the document hierarchy.</p></td>
  </tr>
  <tr>
    <td><h5>Fifth-level Heading</h5></td>
    <td><h5>14px Bold</h5></td>
    <td><p>The heading to the left is an H5 element, which may be used after an H4 heading in the document hierarchy.</p></td>
  </tr>
  <tr>
    <td><h6 style="text-transform:uppercase;">Sixth-level Heading</h5></td>
    <td><h6 style="text-transform:uppercase;">12px Uppercase</h6></td>
    <td><p>The heading to the left is an H6 element, which may be used after an H5 heading in the document hierarchy.</p></td>
  </tr>
</table>
<h3>Text Formatting</h3>
<table class="table">
  <tr>
    <th style="width:33.333%">Element</th>
    <th style="width:33.333%">Size</th>
    <th>Description</th>
  </tr>
  <tr>
    <td><strong>Bold (strong) text</strong></td>
    <td>Inherited</td>
    <td>Use <code>&lt;strong&gt;</code> for <strong>Bold</strong> text.</td>
  </tr>
  <tr>
    <td><em>Italic (emphasized) text</em></td>
    <td>Inherited</td>
    <td> Use <code>&lt;em&gt;</code> for <em>italicized</em> text.</td>
  </tr>
  <tr>
    <td><small>Small text</small></td>
    <td>85% of default size</td>
    <td>Use <code>&lt;small&gt;</code>  for <small>smaller</small> text.</td>
  </tr>
  <tr>
    <td><a href="#">Hyperlink</a></td>
    <td>Inherited</td>
    <td>
      <p>Unless specified by another component, hyperlinks use the standard hyperlink color <span style="color:#3179C2;">#3179C2</span> and are not underlined except on hover.</p>
    </td>
  </tr>
  <tr>
    <td>Ordered List</td>
    <td>
      <ol>
        <li>Item</li>
        <li>Item</li>
        <li>Item</li>
      </ol>
    </td>
    <td><p>Use ordered lists to semantically group items in a pre-determined order</p></td>
  </tr>
  <tr>
    <td>Unordered List</td>
    <td>
      <ul>
        <li>Item</li>
        <li>Item</li>
        <li>Item</li>
      </ul>
    </td>
    <td><p>Use unordered lists to semantically group related items</p></td>
  </tr>
</table>
